This cruiser can also be found in the Battle for the Pacific Victory at Sea starter set.

—description from the publisher

Name: Victory at Sea: Kumano 1944
Description:
Kumano was of the Mogami-class, which consisted of four heavy cruisers which served in the Imperial Japanese Navy. These were exceptionally large for light cruisers, but were constructed in such a manner as to obey the Washington Naval Treaty of 1922, but could easily be refitted as heavy cruisers by refitting their batteries with twin 8-inch guns. This was completed in 1937.

Kumano served in numerous engagements during the war, tangling with British steamships in the Indian Ocean Raids, supporting the reinforcement of Guadalcanal and escorting “Tokyo Express” convoys. Struck by two American torpedoes from Submarines in November 1944, she was towed to Santa Cruz to enact repairs. However, she came under attack by aircraft launched from the carrier USS Ticonderoga, rolling over and sinking.

This cruiser can also be found in the Battle for the Pacific Victory at Sea starter set.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Victory at Sea: USS Northampton 1942
Description:
The lead of her class, the USS Northampton was initially classified as a light cruiser because for relatively thin armour but was later reclassified to a heavy cruiser owing to her 8-inch guns. She served in the Pacific theatre as part of USS Enterprises task force, screening the carrier at the Battle of Midway. She later participated in the operations of Guadalcanal.

During attempts to prevent Japanese reinforcements to Guadalcanal, she fought in the Battle of Tassafaronga. Towards the end of this engagement, Northampton was struck by two torpedoes and was sunk, though most of her crew survived and were rescued and picked up by Task Force 67.

This cruiser can also be found in the Battle for the Pacific Victory at Sea starter set.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Victory at Sea: Furutaka 1939
Description:
Furutaka was the lead of her two-ship class of heavy cruiser. She was named for the mountain located on the island of Etajima, off Hiroshima bay, directly behind the Imperial Japanese Navy Academy.

She participated in the Battle of the Coral Sea and the Battle of Savo Island, but met her fate at the Battle of Cape Esperance on 12th October 1942, at the hand of USS Salt Lake City and USS Duncan.

This cruiser can also be found in the Battle for the Pacific Victory at Sea starter set.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Victory at Sea: USS Chicago 1942
Description:
A Northampton-class vessel, Chicago served in the Pacific during the early years of World War Two. Though surviving attacks by midget submarines in Sydney Harbour and serving in the battle of the Coral Sea and Savo Island in 1942, it was at the Battle of Rennell Island that she was sunk on 30 January 1943, when she was struck by Japanese aerial torpedoes whilst escorting a convoy bound for Guadalcanal.

This cruiser can also be found in the Battle for the Pacific Victory at Sea starter set.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Victory at Sea: Fubuki-class Destroyers
Description:
Fubuki-class are described as the world’s first “modern” destroyer, twenty-four of the class served in the Imperial Japanese Navy. They were built between 1926 and 1933, and despite being decidedly older than some of their adversaries, they remained formidable opponents until the end of the war.

Of the twenty-four vessels, only two survived the war, with eight sunk by submarine, two by mines and many by air attacks. Notably, the Ayanami traded fire with the battleship USS North Dakota during the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal, inflicting severe damage, but was then set upon by USS Washington.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Victory at Sea: Fletcher-class Destroyers
Description:
Designed in 1939, some 175 Fletcher-class destroyers were commissioned between 1942 and 1944, more than any other class of destroyer. They performed every task expected of a destroyer, including anti-aircraft, anti-submarine and more traditional surface-based actions.

They served almost exclusively in the Pacific during World War II, capable of covering the vast distances required by fleet actions. In total, Fletcher-class destroyers accounted for the destruction of 20 Imperial Japanese Navy submarines. 
The 'Fletcher-class was considered a successful design and many went on to serve in the Korean War and at Vietnam.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Four Day Weekend
Description:
Slacking isn't just a pastime, it's a calling. Four Day Weekend players build card sets detailing the true art of avoiding work. Each set must show a (not very) plausible reason for missing work, the real activity the slacker is pursuing, and one to four methods of attaining the necessities for survival while not working: food, cash, shelter, and transportation.

Players begin each turn with up to five cards in hand, discarding and replenishing before actually playing cards into sets. The discards are placed in front of the player - replenishment cards can be taken from the draw pile or from other players' discard rows. Once the player has five cards, he/she creates and adds to sets.

Points for sets are calculated from base card values, card combination multipliers, and bonus card conditions.

For example, the player might start a new set with the "Fell Off The Roof Again" Excuse. She adds the "Building a Couch Fort" Activity and the "Van Full of Nuns" Transportation card she picked up from another player's discard pile.

Each round ends when at least three complete sets have been created and a player declares "Back to Work-ish." Total up the sets, and the slacker with the most points wins.

Name: Shooting Stars: Wargames Rules for Simulating Space Warfare in the Far Future
Description:
Shooting stars

Gaming space battles, the cinematic way!

Fast play space gaming rules, designed for maximum flexibility and minimum hassle, using any old models that you have lying around!

Detailed rulebook and ready ref sheet.

Four example spacefaring Cultures to battle.

Name: Shooting Stars: Around the Table
Description:
Around the Table is a supplement book for Shooting Stars the space warfare simulation wargame.

Contains descriptions and ship detail sheets for sixteen new Spacefaring Cultures!

Warning:  This is not a complete game.  You must have a copy of Shooting Stars to fully utilise this book.

—description from the publisher

Name: Shooting Stars: Constellation!
Description:
Constellation! - a supplement book for Shooting Stars! the space warfare simulation wargame.

Contains descriptions and ship detail sheets for sixteen new Spacefaring Cultures!

Warning:  This is not a complete game.  You must have a copy of Shooting Stars to fully utilise this book.

—description from the publisher

Name: Village Builder
Description:
Medieval cities: they’re cramped, muddy, and generally unpleasant. You want something more. So, you’ve set out on your own to forge a new path. Start a village from meager beginnings and perhaps someday it will grow into your very own cramped, muddy, and generally unpleasant city!

Village Builder is a hand management tile laying worker placement game. The goal  is to accrue as many victory points as you can by building a bustling village.

Use workers to collect resources from your existing building tiles and increase the size of your village. Points are accrued by laying tiles in sets of matching residential and industrial tiles, along with non-matching commercial tiles. Increase your score by upgrading buildings to Level 2 or 3; transform the Peasant Hut into the Noble House! Bonus points can be accrued by strategically placing buildings like the Workshop, Vineyard, Blacksmith, and Tanner.

—description from the designer

Name: Flames of War: Race To Minsk –  Ace Campaign
Description:
Race to Minsk is the second in a series of Ace Campaigns, a narrative-driven system of Flames Of War battles. 
Ace Campaigns are extremely flexible in allowing players to tailor their campaign to fit their playgroups needs. 
There are three different modes that you can play the campaign in: 

    Story Mode, 
     Extended Mode, and
     Aces Mode. 


Story mode is your shortest campaign that only uses the Story and Reward cards, while Extended allows you to play longer campaigns by adding in side missions. 
The Aces mode can be used with Story Mode or Extended Mode and allows players to create their own unique commander with special abilities that will give them an edge during the course of the campaign.

Contains ten Story Episode Mission Cards, eight Story Epilogue Cards, ten Side Mission Cards, 16 Ace Cards, 20 Reward Cards and one Ace Campaign Rule booklet.

Name: Flames of War: Bagration – River Assault Mission Terrain Pack
Description:
The opening of Operation Bagration was fought across Byelorussia, a land of forests, farms, rivers and wooded
marshes. In Poland terrain was similar, mostly flat with rivers, lakes, woods, and villages breaking up the farmland.
Fighting in the Ukraine crossed fertile plains of farmland and woods, crisscrossed with rivers, before hitting the
Carpathian Mountains that divide the Ukraine from Slovakia and Hungary.

This pack adds some terrain (cardboard) as well as campaign scenarios together with the defense unit cards needed to play.

Contains one 12” x 48" River Mat, five Cardboard Punch-out Sheets, four Defence Unit Cards, one Mission and Rules Booklet

Name: Blobby's Pizza
Description:
Win this monster pizza-eating contest by eating your way to the highest bill. Complete pizza to eat pizza, take pizza to make pizza, and always keep your eyes on your pies!

A strategic set-building, take that card game with a 128 deck card game consisting of various pizza fraction cards (plain, pepperoni, veggie and supreme) as well as 7 different pizza eating monster character cards who eat different sizes of pizza fractions. Accumulate cards as you go as you try to build whole pizzas to add to your guest check. Protect cards in your 5 card hand (called the "plate") and store extra cards on your "table," which are subject to being stolen by other players monster cards. Use Switch and Swap waiter cards to switch cards or game play direction. Advanced play options include use of Tax and Tip cards for an added layer of strategic play and more advanced educational content.

Includes a realistic/retro guest check score pad for adding final scores. A fun way to teach fractions, decimals and percentages.

-description from designer

Name: Clan War: Crane Army Expansion
Description:
Clan War: Crane Army Expansion is a source book containing all the information needed to play a Crane Army in Clan War

     history, 
     units,
     organization, and
     tactics
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Clan War: Lion Army Expansion
Description:
Clan War: Lion Army Expansion is a source book containing all the information needed to play a Lion Army  in Clan War

     history, 
     units,
     organization, and
     tactics
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Clan War: Naga Army Expansion
Description:
Clan War: Naga Army Expansion is a source book containing all the information needed to play a Naga Army in Clan War.

The Way of the Willow. 
Bloodlines. 
Rules additions. 
Naga forces, units, and personalities.
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Clan War: Scorpion Army Expansion
Description:
Clan War: Scorpion Army Expansion is a source book containing all the information needed to play a Scorpion Army in Clan War.

History.
Rules additions.
Scorpion Clan treatise, forces, units, and personalities. Ishkawa's Allegiance.
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Clan War: Shadowlands Army Expansion
Description:
Clan War: Shadowlands Army Expansion is a source book containing all the information needed to play a Shadowlands Army in Clan War.

Creatures and servants of Fu Leng. 
Kappusku's Story. 
Rules additions. 
Shadowlands Forces.
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Clan War: Toturi's Army and Yoritomo's Alliance
Description:
Clan War: Toturi's Army and Yoritomo's Alliance is a source book containing all the information needed to play a Toturi's Army and Yoritomo's Alliance in Clan War

A Dark Path's Beginning. 
Dawn of Storms. 
Rules additions and errata. 
Toturi/Yoritomo forces.
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Fleet Commander: Nimitz – Total War
Description: Fleet Commander Nimitz Total War is the 2nd expansion for the for Fleet Commander Nimitz solitaire game, that covers the entire Pacific War from the US point of view.  Components include War Sheet, Rulesheet, and additional counters. The expansion adds detailed rules to Fleet Commander Nimitz allowing you fight the War in the Pacific from Pearl Harbor through VJ Day in one campaign.

Name: Clan War: Phoenix Army Expansion
Description:
Clan War: Phoenix Army Expansion is a source book containing all the information needed to play a Phoenix Army  in Clan War.

This 64-page book covers history of the house of the Phoenix; Strength of the Clan; Additional rules; Additional expansions; Rules errata; Phoenix Clan forces and Phoenix Clan philosopy, army structure and battle strategy.
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Fleet Commander: Nimitz – Islands
Description: The 3rd expansion for the Fleet Commander Nimitz game. Components include Island sheets and additional rules. This expansion adds a custom 8.5" x 11" Island sheet with unique rules for each of the islands.

Name: Phoenix Command King Tiger: World War II Heavy Tanks
Description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


This supplement to the Phoenix Command Mechanized Combat System provides the Status Sheets for the primary Heavy Tanks of World War II. Included are the German Pz VI Tiger, the Pz VI King Tiger, the Soviet KV1 with 76mm gun, the "Speedy" KV1S, the KV-85 with 85mm gun, the Joseph Stalin IS2 and IS2m Heavy Tanks with 122mm guns, and the US M4A3E2 "Jumbo" Assault Sherman.In addition, special rules for Vehicle Systems specific to World War II Tanks and Second Shot Accuracy are presented, along with full Vehicle Descriptions.

-from the back of the book

Name: Phoenix Command: Mechanized Light Vehicles
Description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


This Suplement to the Phoenix Command: Mechanized Combat System that covers primary Light Fighting Vehicles.

Name: Phoenix Command: Mechanized Combat System
Description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


The Phoenix Command: Mechanized combines a detailed, accurate simulation of modern tank combat with quick, simple game mechanics to create a system that gives the player a fast playing game of unbeatable realism.

Name: Phoenix Command: Russian Roulette – The Breakup of the Soviet Union
Description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


From the Baltic Republics to the Black Sea to the barricades in Moscow, Russian Roulette takes players to the scenes of the critical military events that led to the vast changes underway in the Soviet Union. Six historical and hypothetical battles are presented in this Scenario Pack, including:Soviet Intervention in Baku: When ethnic strife between Armenians and Azerbaijanis went out of control in early 1990, Soviet troops were called in to bring order to Baku, Azerbaijan's capital. This Scenario is a night street battle between Soviets and a crowd of well-armed Demonstrators.

Crackdown in Latvia: In January of 1991, the Soviets sent troops into seven different Republics in an attempt to end nationalist movements. In this Scenario, Soviet Special Forces fight Latvian police for control of the Interior Ministry building, in a battle that was televised internationally.

Other Scenarios cover Black Berets in Lithuania, Vigilantes in Azerbaijan, and Ethnic Strife in Georgia. There is even a Scenario for what might have happened if the Soviet military had tried to kill Boris Yeltsin during August's failed Coup. Each Scenario includes a detailed Map, special rules, and full data for all the combatants. Also included is background material for each of the Scenarios, plus an overview of the Soviet military and security forces.

-from the back cover

Name: Phoenix Command: Mechanized Pak Front – World War II Anti-Tank Guns
Description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


This supplement to the Phoenix Command Mechanized Combat System provides the Weapon Data for the primary Anti-Tank Guns of World War II.Included are the 24 most prominent Anti-Tank Guns of the war, from the German 37mm Pak 36 to the devastating 88mm Pak 43, and from the British 2 Pounder to the US M5 3 Inch Gun and the Soviet 100mm D-10. Full descriptions of each Gun are also given, as are the special rules for using World War II Anti-Tank Guns.

-from the back of the book
